blocks.text: What is the Church?

When the Bible talks about the church, it is not talking about a building. A church is a local family of baptized believers who have come together around the gospel of Jesus Christ. They gather to worship, to grow in God's Word, to observe baptism and the Lord's Supper, and to encourage one another to live under the lordship of Christ. Every member has been given gifts by the Holy Spirit, and every member is responsible and accountable to Jesus as Lord. The local church exists to make disciples and to carry the gospel to the ends of the earth.

But the church is also something bigger than any one congregation. The Bible calls it the Body of Christ, and that body includes every person who has ever been saved by grace through faith, from every tribe, tongue, and nation across all of history. When you became a follower of Jesus, you were not just starting a personal journey. You were joined to a family that stretches across the whole world and all the way back to the very first believers. God sent the Holy Spirit to empower and unify this family around the gospel, and being planted in a local church is how you experience that Christ-centered community firsthand.
And he (God the Father) put all things under his (Jesus') feet and gave him as head over all things to the church, which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.

5.1 - Consider how Jesus lived His life. What are a few attitudes or actions that the church should follow and imitate? (ex. Jesus sacrificed, Jesus taught the truth, Jesus showed unconditional love...)
A Healthy Church 1) Loves, 2) Equips, 3) Serves
1) The Church Loves
So now I am giving you a new commandment: Love each other. Just as I have loved you, you should love each other. Your love for one another will prove to the world that you are my disciples. ~Jesus
5.2 - Imagine a community who loves each other unconditionally, not based on what they do but based on who God says they are. Describe what these relationships would be like.

And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers. And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles. And all who believed were together and had all things in common. And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need. And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts, praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved.
5.3 - Acts 2:42-47 describes a group of believers that seems to meet often. How important is it for a Christian to gather with the church? If you attend church, how often and why do you go?
2) The Church Equips

The early church devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching. Just as Jesus equipped His disciples through both word and deed, the Church provides Biblical teaching alongside practical examples of living out the faith.
5.4 - In what ways have you been equipped by the church to live out your faith? What are some areas you would like more equipping?
3) The Church Serves

The early church was active in the community, selling possessions to help those in need. After Jesus washed the disciples' feet, He said in John 13:14-15 "If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another's feet. For I have given you an example, that you also should do just as I have done to you."

5.5 - What ways are you currently serving or ways you would like to serve in the community and in the church? (Community: Volunteer in a school, coach a team, scouts, work with the elderly... Church: Help with kids or youth, building and grounds teams, worship and tech team...)
Lesson 5 Review

You have explored what the church is meant to be and why God designed us to grow together rather than alone. Being planted in a church family is one of the main ways God shapes, sustains, and sends you.

blocks.heading: Introduction to John 13, 14, and 15
blocks.intro: In John 13-15, Jesus is with His closest friends on the night before the cross. He washes their feet, gives them a new commandment to love one another the way He has loved them, and promises that the Holy Spirit will come to help them. This is a picture of the kind of community He is calling the church to be.
